subject: Marketing
title: Ad Fatigue
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Ad Fatigue.

hook.text: A banner ad gets a 0.05% click rate. People see right through it.

buildup.text: Banner blindness is real. The brain learns to skip anything that looks like an ad.

discovery.text: Ad fatigue happens when repetition crosses from familiarity into annoyance.

twist.text: The same ad that boosted sales in week one can hurt your brand by week eight.

climax.text: Smart brands rotate creative often and vary formats to stay below the fatigue line.

punchline.text: Repetition builds brands until it kills them.

quiz.question: What causes ad fatigue?
options: Repetition crossing from familiarity into annoyance
Using too many different creative formats
